thread.title: David Beckham hits the gym amid email hacking scandal
thread.title_full: David Beckham hits the gym amid email hacking scandal | Daily Mail Online

author: Rebecca Lawrence For Mailonline
title: David Beckham hits the gym amid email hacking scandal
text:
He's been caught up in an email hacking scandal that revealed he had branded the Honours Committee ‘unappreciative c***s’ for passing him over on a knighthood.
But David Beckham seemed to be brushing off the drama by squeezing in a workout as he hit the gym in London on Thursday.
Enjoying a post session shake, the former footballer, 41, kept a blank expression as he headed home with his headphones in.
Scroll down for video
Business as usual: David Beckham seemed to be brushing off the drama caused by his email hacking scandal by squeezing in a workout as he hit the gym in London on Thursday
Layering up, the sports star donned a navy Adidas hoodie with grey shorts.
He also donned a pair of running leggings and beige trainers with a fluorescent orange sole.
David finished off the look with a brown beanie hat, whilst his beard was expertly sculpted and groomed.
Tasty: Enjoying a post session smoothie, the former footballer, 41, kept a blank expression as he headed home with his headphones in
The former Manchester United player has been continuing with his day to day activities since damaging correspondence between himself and PR chief Simon Oliveira were leaked.
In the leak, David reacted angrily when he found out he had been passed over for a knighthood.
The former England captain branded the Honours Committee ‘unappreciative c***s’ and dismissed lower awards, ranting: ‘Unless it’s a knighthood f*** off’.
Gym gear: Layering up, the sports star donned a navy Adidas hoodie with grey shorts. He also donned a pair of running leggings and beige trainers with a fluorescent orange sole
He allegedly continued to rant at the honours committee, saying he 'expected nothing less' and asking 'who decides the honours?'
It's a disgrace to be honest and if I was American I would of got something like this ten years ago,' he continued.
A spokesman for the star said: ‘This story is based on outdated material taken out of context from hacked and doctored private emails from a third party server and gives a deliberately inaccurate picture.’
Never looked Beck-er: David finished off the look with a brown beanie hat, whilst his beard was expertly sculpted and groomed
In another email, David dismissed Oliveira's suggestion that he put one million dollars (£800,000) into a prize-giving Unicef dinner in Shanghai.
Beckham allegedly replied: 'I don't want to put my personal money into this cause,' claiming he added: 'To pour this million into the fund, is like putting my own money in.
'If there was no fund, the money would be for me. This f*
